intro: Viburnum tengyuehense var. sterile, commonly known as the sterile form of the Tengyuehense viburnum, is a unique variant of this shrub native to China. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. Unlike its fertile counterpart, this variety does not produce viable seeds, making it valuable for ornamental purposes. The plant typically features clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in the spring. Its foliage is usually dark green and glossy, adding visual interest throughout the growing season.
